gurmukhi: ਸੁ ਬਸਤ੍ਰੰ ੳੁਤਾਰੇ || ਭਗਵੇ ਬਸਤ੍ਰ ਧਾਰੇ ||
transliteration: Su Bastran Outdare|| Bhagve Bastra Dhdare||
translation: He wore the garments of a Yogi on forsaking the beautiful royal dress,

gurmukhi: ਬਸਯੋ ਲੰਕ ਬਾਗੰ || ਪੁਨਰ ਦ੍ਰੋਹ ਤਿਅਾਗੰ ||੮੨||
transliteration: Basyo Lank Baagadg|| Pounar Droh Tiaagadg||82||
translation: And abandoning all inimical ideas, he began to live in a cottage in Lanka.82.
Subahu marched forward alongwith his soldiers in great rage,]

gurmukhi: ਠਟਯੋ ਅਾਣ ਜੁਧੰ || ਭਯੋ ਨਾਦ ੳੁੱਧੰ ||੮੩||
transliteration: Thatyo Aan Judhan|| Bhayo Naad Uddhan||83||
translation: And in the war of arrows, he also heard the terrible sound.83.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਭੰ ਸੈਣ ਸਾਜੀ || ਤੁਰੇ ਤੁੰਦ ਤਾਜੀ ||
transliteration: Soubhan Sain Saajee|| Ture Tound Taajee||
translation: In the bedecked forces, very swift horses began to run;

gurmukhi: ਗਜਾ ਜੂਹ ਗੱਜੇ || ਧੁਣੰ ਮੇਘ ਲੱਜੇ ||੮੪||
transliteration: Gadaa Jooh Gadje|| Dhounan Megh Lajje||84||
translation: The elephants roared in all the for directions and in front of their roars, the thunder of clouds appeared very dull.84.

gurmukhi: ਢਕਾ ਢੁੱਕ ਢਾਲੰ || ਸੁਭੀ ਪੀਤ ਲਾਲੰ ||
translation: The knocking on the shields was audible and the yellow and red shields looked impressive.
The warriors began to rise holding their weapons in their hands, and there was a continuous flow of shafts.85.

gurmukhi: ਬਹੈ ਅਗਨ ਅਸਤ੍ਰੰ || ਛੁਟੇ ਸਰਬ ਸਸਤ੍ਰੰ ||
transliteration: Bhai Agad Astran|| Chhoute Sarab Sastran||
translation: The fire-shafts were discharged and the weapons began to fall form the hands of the warriors .

gurmukhi: ਰੰਗੇ ਸ੍ਰੋਣ ਅੈਸੇ || ਚੜੇ ਬਯਾਹ ਜੈਸੇ ||੮੬||
transliteration: Rane Sron Aise|| Chade Byaah Jaise||86||
translation: The brave fighters saturated with blood appeared like the participants in a marriage party wearing red garments.86.

gurmukhi: ਘਣੇ ਘਾੲਿ ਘੂਮੇ || ਮਦੀ ਜੈਸ ਝੂਮੇ ||
translation: Many wounded people are roaming like a drunkard swinging in intoxication.

gurmukhi: ਗਹੇ ਬੀਰ ਅੈਸੇ || ਫੁਲੇ ਫੂਲ ਜੈਸੇ ||੮੭||
transliteration: Gade Beer Aise|| Phule Phool Jaise||87||
translation: The warriors have caught hold of each other like a flower meeting the other flower joyfully.87.
The demon-king was killed and he attained his real form.

gurmukhi: ਬਜੇ ਘੋਰ ਬਾਜੇ || ਧੁਣੰ ਅੱਭ੍ਰ ਲਾਜੇ ||੮੮||
transliteration: Bade Ghor Baaje|| Dhounan Abbhra Laaje||88||
translation: The musical instruments were played and listening to their sound, the clouds felt.88.
